item.title: Prince Philip: Royal Family honours duke's 'humour and humanity'
item.description: The funeral congregation was socially distanced, with the Queen seated alone, because of Covid rules.

item.title: Covid-19 deaths pass three million worldwide
item.description: It comes as the World Health Organization warns of deaths and cases increasing at a "worrying rate".

item.title: Prince Philip funeral: William and Harry seen chatting after ceremony
item.description: The funeral of their grandfather marked the princes’ first public appearance together in more than a year.

item.title: Chelsea 1-0 Man City: Thomas Tuchel's side advance to FA Cup final to end City's quadruple hopes
item.description: Chelsea reach the FA Cup final with a narrow victory to end Manchester City's hopes of a historic quadruple.

item.title: Helen McCrory: Stars pay tribute to Peaky Blinders actress
item.description: Cillian Murphy, JK Rowling and Sir Sam Mendes lead tributes to the "fearless and magnificent" actress.

item.title: On the front line in eastern Ukraine
item.description: The BBC's Jonah Fisher reports from the front line between soldiers and separatists.

item.title: Putin critic Navalny could 'die within days', say doctors
item.description: Alexei Navalny is on day 18 of a hunger strike over his medical treatment in a Russian jail.

item.title: Iran nuclear: State TV names suspect in Natanz attack
item.description: State TV alleges Reza Karimi fled Iran before the blast, which damaged its Natanz nuclear plant.

item.title: Duke's former school pays tribute with wreath at sea
item.description: Pupils from Gordonstoun school lay a wreath off the Moray coast where Prince Philip learned to sail.

item.title: Man charged over Buckingham Palace trespass
item.description: A man was detained on Thursday trying to enter a service yard at the royal residence, police say.

item.title: Philippines: Giant clam shells worth $25m seized in raid
item.description: The 200-tonne seizure is one of the largest ever hauls of the endangered species.

item.title: Cambridgeshire Police officer sacked over racial slur
item.description: Chris Tyler used racist language against a colleague at a Christmas party, a hearing finds.

item.title: Plymouth man in his 70s held on suspicion of murder
item.description: A man and a woman are being questioned by police about the death of a man in Plympton, Devon.

item.title: Prince Philip funeral: Pictures as Queen and nation bid farewell to the duke
item.description: Almost 100 years after he entered the world on a dining room table in Corfu, Prince Philip's final journey has taken place.

item.title: Queen and Royal Family alone but for the gaze of the world
item.description: After a week of private grieving, this was the moment the Royal Family's mourning became public.

item.title: Prince Philip: Land Rover hearse and other personal touches at duke's funeral
item.description: Those watching closely noticed carefully placed references to the duke's remarkable life story.

item.title: Prince Philip funeral: Royal Family members walk behind coffin
item.description: The Duke of Edinburgh's four children were among those following him to St George's Chapel.

item.title: Minute's silence ahead of service
item.description: The Queen has led her family in mourning at the funeral of her husband, the Duke of Edinburgh, in the grounds of Windsor Castle.

item.title: Who attended Prince Philip's funeral?
item.description: Covid restrictions mean only 30 mourners were allowed to attend the funeral of the duke.

item.title: Prince Philip: The Patriarchs - An Elegy
item.description: Poet laureate Simon Armitage has written an elegy for Prince Philip, entitled The Patriarchs - An Elegy.

item.title: Prince Philip: A turbulent childhood stalked by exile, mental illness and death
item.description: In marrying, Philip was able to regain the "simple pleasures" of family life he had lost aged eight.

item.title: Prince Philip: A life in pictures
item.description: Key photographs, from his early days in the Greek island of Corfu to school days in Scotland and his life alongside the Queen.

item.title: The Queen and Prince Philip: An enduring royal romance
item.description: During their 73-year marriage, he was the Queen's public support and the person who knew her best.

item.title: Prince Philip: How can Prince Harry attend the funeral?
item.description: The Duke of Sussex has returned to the UK for the first time since "stepping back" from royal duties.

item.title: Prince Philip: An extraordinary man who led an extraordinary life
item.description: The Duke of Edinburgh's life was filled with contradictions but will be remembered most for his unstinting support of the Queen.

item.title: In Pictures: Helen McCrory's acting career
item.description: A look back at the characters portrayed by the British actress, who has died aged 52.

item.title: Hijab regulations: Two women's experience
item.description: Nadya and Emna live 12,000 km away from each other but both have been told what they can and can’t wear.

item.title: Girl, 6, donates 'lifetime of hair' to cancer charity
item.description: Six-year-old Amelia Barratt donates her locks and more than £800 to help children with cancer.

item.title: Covid: Art and challenges keep Para athlete on track
item.description: Tom Wilson, who has cerebral palsy and is profoundly deaf, has not let the pandemic hold him back.

item.title: Week in pictures: 10 - 16 April 2021
item.description: A selection of powerful images taken around the world this week.

item.title: Nepal fires: 'We saw huge flames coming towards our garden’
item.description: This year’s wildfire season in Nepal has been worse than usual with more fires, burning longer.

item.title: Sputnik V: How Russia's Covid vaccine is dividing Europe
item.description: The vaccine has not yet been approved by Europe's medicines agency but orders are piling in.

item.title: Covid map: Coronavirus cases, deaths, vaccinations by country
item.description: Key maps and charts explaining how the virus has spread around the world.

item.title: Cinema and big event organisers targeted by extreme anti-vax activists
item.description: Large events are going ahead this weekend as part of trials to reopen the economy, but some are receiving hate for participating.

item.title: Pub and shop staff: 'Please be nice to us this weekend'
item.description: Newsbeat hears from staff heading back to work after four months away.

item.title: 20 years in Afghanistan: Was it worth it?
item.description: The BBC's Frank Gardner asks the awkward question about a war with an astronomical human cost.

item.title: Reopening verdict: 'It was 'buzzing, chaotic and crazy'
item.description: Business owners tell how their first week of trading has gone after lockdown rules eased in England and Wales.

item.title: Sport pauses for Prince Philip's funeral
item.description: Tributes have been paid across the sporting world on the day of the Duke of Edinburgh's funeral.

item.title: O'Sullivan wins as snooker fans return to the Crucible for World Championship
item.description: Ronnie O'Sullivan starts his World Championship title with a convincing win over Mark Joyce as fans return to sporting events in the UK.

item.title: FA Cup: Chelsea 1-0 Manchester City highlights
item.description: Watch highlights as Hakim Ziyech's second-half strike ends Manchester City's quadruple dream and sees Chelsea through to the FA Cup final.

item.title: FA Cup: If MOTD was a reality TV show... Lineker shows Richards the red card
item.description: Gary Lineker spoofs a reality TV show, teasing Ashley Cole and Micah Richards about which of them will be a pundit for the FA Cup Final.

item.title: Watch the best tries as France thrash Ireland in Women's Six Nations
item.description: Watch the best tries from France's 56-15 win over Ireland which seals their place in the Six Nations final against England next weekend.

item.title: What's the roadmap for lifting lockdown?
item.description: Pub gardens and non-essential shops can now open in England - as part of the next stage of easing lockdown rules.

item.title: Coronavirus: What's the risk on transport?
item.description: As UK coronavirus restrictions continue to be relaxed, public transport could become much busier.

item.title: Covid-19 in the UK: How many coronavirus cases are there in your area?
item.description: Explore the data on coronavirus in the UK and find out how many cases there are in your area.

item.title: Covid vaccine: How many people in the UK have been vaccinated so far?
item.description: The logistics of vaccinating millions of people across the country, as more than 32 million people receive at least one dose.

item.title: Covid: What's happening with universities as lockdown eases?
item.description: Face-to-face courses cannot resume on campuses in England until at least 17 May.

item.title: Why are so many babies dying of Covid-19 in Brazil?
item.description: As the pandemic rages in Brazil, hundreds of babies and young children are dying of Covid.

item.title: Race report: Was controversy part of the plan?
item.description: How the government handled the release of a contentious report on racial disparity in the UK.

item.title: 'We found a baby on the subway - now he's our son'
item.description: Danny Stewart saw something on the floor of an NY subway station - soon he would treasure it more than anything.

item.title: Letterbox contact: ‘Don’t my birth children have a right to know I’m dying?'
item.description: Diagnosed with a terminal illness, Hanna wanted to tell the twins taken from her at 16 - but had no way of reaching them.
